full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 166 of 247 294 LBUVMAX4 Jane - direct 1 And I said, Well, my father just passed away. But my mother's name is. 3 And he said, I think we know your mom. It's kind of a smaller town. We definitely know her. 5 And I said, You know, my parents were sort of out on the scene, and my father was a musician, and so that would make sense. 8 And he had a newspaper under his arm. And then he put the newspaper on the picnic table and said, Well, what's your mom's name? 10 Gave my mom's name. 12 And he said, Well, what's her phone number? 13 I just kind of went, Okay. He's asking me for a number, so I gave it to him. And so I gave my mom's, which, you know, at the time was just a landline. 16 Q. How did that conversation end? 17 A. It just sort of ended like, It was, you know, so nice to meet you and I'm going to call your mom. That was it. 19 Q. That man and that woman that you had this conversation with, who were they? 21 A. Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. 22 Q. What was your impression of them at that point? 23 A. They seemed very friendly. I thought they were a married couple. They seemed inquisitive. And it made sense, I guess, if they spent time there, that they wanted to know what the -- SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00011938
